name: backend-development
description: Comprehensive backend development support including REST/GraphQL/gRPC APIs, microservices architecture, distributed systems, TDD orchestration, and scalable backend patterns for modern applications. v1.0.3 enhances feature-development command with execution modes, agent reference table, and comprehensive external documentation (6 files covering methodology, phases, agent orchestration, deployment strategies, best practices, and success metrics).
changelog: v1.0.3: Enhanced /feature-development command with YAML frontmatter (3 execution modes: quick/standard/enterprise), agent reference table for 10 specialized agents, condensed step descriptions with external doc links, comprehensive 6-file documentation suite (methodology-guides.md covering TDD/BDD/DDD, phase-templates.md with detailed checklists, agent-orchestration.md with 5 orchestration patterns, deployment-strategies.md for 5 deployment strategies, best-practices.md for production readiness, success-metrics.md with quantified criteria). Enhanced usability with clear execution modes, better agent coordination guidance, and complete reference library. Maintains 100% backward compatibility.
author: Wei Chen

agents.name: Backend Architect
agents.description: Expert backend architect specializing in scalable API design, microservices architecture, and distributed systems
agents.improvements: Added triggering criteria with decision tree, 6-step chain-of-thought reasoning framework, 5 Constitutional AI principles, comprehensive event-driven architecture example with full implementation. Expected: 30% better service boundary identification, 40% reduction in over-engineering, 50% improvement in resilience pattern adoption.

agents.name: GraphQL Architect
agents.description: Master modern GraphQL with federation, performance optimization, and enterprise security
agents.improvements: Added triggering criteria for GraphQL-specific tasks, 5-step chain-of-thought reasoning (Schema → Performance → Authorization → Federation → Verification), 5 GraphQL-specific Constitutional AI principles, comprehensive N+1 elimination example with DataLoader. Expected: 60% reduction in N+1 problems, 45% better schema evolution practices, 50% improvement in authorization implementation.

agents.name: TDD Orchestrator
agents.description: Master TDD orchestrator specializing in red-green-refactor discipline and multi-agent workflow coordination
agents.improvements: Added triggering criteria for TDD orchestration vs simple testing, 6-step chain-of-thought orchestration (Maturity Assessment → Workflow Design → Architecture → Agent Coordination → Metrics → Verification), 5 TDD-specific Constitutional AI principles, comprehensive payment microservice example with pre-commit hooks and metrics dashboard. Expected: 70% better test-first discipline enforcement, 50% improvement in test quality (mutation score), 45% better agent coordination efficiency.

commands.name: /feature-development
commands.description: Orchestrate end-to-end feature development from requirements to production deployment with 3 execution modes (quick/standard/enterprise) and comprehensive external documentation
commands.improvements: v1.0.3 Enhancement: Added YAML frontmatter with 3 execution modes (quick: 1-2 days MVP, standard: 3-14 days full workflow, enterprise: 2-4 weeks with compliance), agent reference table for 10 specialized agents, condensed step descriptions with external doc links, comprehensive 6-file documentation suite (methodology guides covering TDD/BDD/DDD, phase templates with detailed checklists, agent orchestration patterns, deployment strategies for canary/blue-green/feature-flags/A/B testing, best practices for production readiness, quantified success metrics). Enhanced usability with clear execution modes, better agent coordination guidance, and complete reference library without increasing command token cost.

skills.name: API Design Principles
skills.description: Best practices and patterns for designing REST, GraphQL, and gRPC APIs
skills.improvements: Enhanced description with 20+ specific use cases, expanded 'When to use' section with 21 detailed examples covering REST, GraphQL, pagination, versioning, authentication, rate limiting, webhooks, and more.

skills.name: Architecture Patterns
skills.description: Backend architecture patterns including microservices, event-driven, and distributed systems
skills.improvements: Enhanced description with 25+ use cases covering Clean Architecture, Hexagonal Architecture, DDD, CQRS, Event Sourcing, expanded 'When to use' section with 22 detailed examples.

skills.name: Auth Implementation Patterns
skills.description: Authentication and authorization patterns for secure backend systems
skills.improvements: Enhanced description with 25+ use cases covering JWT, OAuth2, RBAC, session management, MFA, SSO, expanded 'When to use' section with 24 detailed examples.

skills.name: Error Handling Patterns
skills.description: Error handling and resilience patterns for robust backend services
skills.improvements: Enhanced description with 20+ use cases covering exceptions, Result types, circuit breakers, retry logic, graceful degradation, expanded 'When to use' section with 24 detailed examples.

skills.name: Microservices Patterns
skills.description: Microservices architecture patterns and best practices
skills.improvements: Enhanced description with 20+ use cases covering service boundaries, Saga patterns, API Gateway, event-driven architecture, expanded 'When to use' section with 24 detailed examples.

skills.name: SQL Optimization Patterns
skills.description: Database query optimization and SQL performance tuning patterns
skills.improvements: Enhanced description with 20+ use cases covering EXPLAIN analysis, indexing strategies, N+1 elimination, pagination, batch operations, expanded 'When to use' section with 25 detailed examples.
